Package tr.edu.boun.osmansarioglu

Class Separator

java.lang.Object
tr.edu.boun.osmansarioglu.Separator
public class Separator
extends java.lang.Object

Separator Class

The Separator class has the code for dividing given String input into proper pieces and storing them.

It uses ArrayList class having Object class for storing data after validating their format

It has 3 different methods to make these operations:

separateMe(String[] valStr) : Divides given String valStr into pieces, and keep them at ArryList of Object type after validation whether they are numbers or operators. "Object" type is used to have flexibility at "Engine" class which sends parameters to "Calculator" class.

validateMe(String checkMe) : Makes validation of given String whether is a numerical expression in expected format.

checkAllNumeric(String checkStr) : Makes validation of given String whether there is no non-numerical expression

Since:
2020-12-19
Version:
1.0
Author:
Osman Selçuk Sarıoğlu

  • Constructor Details

    • Separator

      public Separator​(java.lang.String inStr, Engine engine)

      Constructor for Separator

      This is used a constructor for new Separators. It gets parameter as String inStr and Engine engine which is used to track "Error state" during all operations

      Parameters:
      inStr - Method gets inStr String as parameter. inStr is representing input to be split and validated.
      runningEngine - Method gets runningEngine Engine object as parameter. runningEngine is used to handle calculation state and error message handling.
